title: Calories in Skirt Steak
meta_description: Discover calories in skirt steak per 100 g, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Beef skirt steak, separable lean and fat, trimmed to 0" fat, choice grade, cooked by grilling; no added oils or marinades.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, grade, cooking method, fat trimming, and source; values are averages—check labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of grilled skirt steak provides ~271 kcal and ~25 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Trim visible fat before cooking (per 100 g)
Marinated with 1 tbsp oil and soy sauce (per 100 g)
Pan-seared with 1 tsp butter added (per 100 g)

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g skirt steak?
faqs.a: About 271 kcal for grilled skirt steak with lean and fat.

faqs.q: Is skirt steak high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, ~25 g protein per 100 g, making it great for muscle-building meals.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in skirt steak?
faqs.a: Around 18.4 g total fat per 100 g, including 7.4 g saturated.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in skirt steak?
faqs.a: Yes—grilling is lower cal than frying; added fats increase totals.

faqs.q: How does skirt steak compare to other steaks calorie-wise?
faqs.a: Similar to flank steak (~200-270 kcal/100 g) but higher fat than lean sirloin (~180 kcal).
